title: Software Engineer
description:
**Why Hedin IT?**  

We shape the digital future for Hedin Mobility Group - one of Europe’s leading mobility enablers with 15,000 employees across 14 countries. To be a transformative force within mobility, we need to offer the best digital experience possible for both our customers and colleagues. This means you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, dedicated colleagues, and great challenges to keep pushing your professional and personal development.


Have we caught your attention yet? Great - we are looking for new colleagues to join our IMS (*Importer Management System*) team in developing one of our most business-critical systems. Built for importers within the group, the system combines everything from ERP and logistics to dealer portals, e-commerce, BI, and beyond - all in one.

**Let us tell you more about the role!**  

As a Software Engineer in our IMS team, you will develop our modern web-based business system built on top of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. With great room for creativity and innovation, you will implement the system for new entities within the group, develop new features, and make improvements to enable a more robust solution.


You will join a cross-functional high-performing team, but most of all, a team of great people who all love tech. Everyone is highly involved in discussions around architecture and system design (no PowerPoint architects in sight) and shares a philosophy of avoiding unnecessary processes at all costs.


**Want a taste of what technologies you will be working with?**

* C#/.NET
* Blazor
* Azure
* Terraform
* Entity Framework
* Clean, testable, and domain-driven code
* Event-driven infrastructure
* Structured pair programming (we know it is not a technology, but it is damn important)

**Who are we looking for?**  

Even though you will be working with all the technologies above and more, we do not expect you to be an expert in all of them, but at least some. For us, it is more important that you have can do-attitude and constantly want to push boundaries of both your own and your teams’ knowledge and skills. You are comfortable with **speaking and writing both Swedish and English** and have a couple of years of working experience with:

* C#/.NET
* Azure
* SQL Databases
* Testable and domain-driven code

**So, are you r****eady to accelerate your career with us? Apply now!**  

The Hedin IT recruitment team is on vacation. We are excited to resume the recruitment process when we are back in week 34. In the meantime, feel free to apply today! Responsible for the recruitment, Gabriella Hagström, gabriella.hagstrom@hedinit.com. Have a great summer!

 ***About us***  

*Since 2017, Hedin IT has been leading the technical way forward for Hedin Mobility Group, one of Europe’s leading mobility enablers with 15,000 employees across 14 countries. To be the transformative force within mobility, we need to offer the best possible digital experience for both our customers and colleagues within the group. This means you'll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, dedicated colleagues, and great challenges to keep pushing your professional and personal development.*

***What do we offer?***  

*The dynamic and fast paced environment of a scale-up with the stability and resources that comes with being part of a large, established group. The best of both worlds if you ask us.*

*Our modern office located here in Mölndal offers both café and restaurant as well as gym and padel facility (fun fact: we ended up in the top ten best-looking offices in Sweden 2023, if you’ll allow us to brag a little). Your well-being is important to us, which is why we offer PTs, instructor-led training classes every day and the opportunity to challenge your colleagues in a game of padel. And of course:*  



* *Collective Agreement and ITP pensions.*
* *Flexible working hours*
* *Wellness allowance*
* *30 days of paid vacation*
* *Several car-related benefits*

title: Technology Manager IoT
description:
**Technology Manager IoT - Join a Global Leader in Security Innovation**
 Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and eager to make an impact in the physical access control industry? ASSA ABLOY, a leader in the security industry, is looking for a dynamic and driven Technology Manager IoT to join our team. This is your chance to shape the future of smart lock technology and be at the forefront of innovation.
   

  

**About Us**
 Located within the Group CTO organization, Technology Solutions develop internal Modular Technology Platforms primarily for battery-based Smart Locks. Our platforms enable rapid innovation, faster time-to-market, and offer premium security levels that meet upcoming security legislations. Our three core modular platforms are:
   

  

* MBS : Hardware/Firmware
* MSF : Software
* mIoT : Connectivity (the link between MBS and MSF)


 All our platforms are developed collaboratively using inner sourcing (internal open source) with centralized teams that maintain, lead, and form the architecture. We work closely with various ASSA ABLOY divisions and their business use cases to ensure our platforms meet real-world needs.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As the Technology Manager IoT, you will act as the system architect and product owner for our MSF platforms, which handle device management of IoT devices, including both server/cloud and mobile apps (Android/iOS). Your primary use cases will include device configuration and communication with Smart Locks. You will define technical features, support the definition of an ecosystem for all product lifecycle phases (manufacturing, configuration/commissioning, operation, decommissioning), and break down end-to-end use cases into technical platform features.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Act as Product Owner of the MSF Device Configuration Team and MSF Backend Team
* Serve as the system architect for device configuration use cases and backend parts of IoT connectivity
* Build a global understanding of customer needs through local divisions and customer insight activities, and translate these into product backlog activities
* Coordinate requirements between Technology Solutions and local/divisional software architects
* Design modular platforms and services to create robust, reusable, and shared components
* Drive pre-studies for new features/products/use cases
* Establish design guidelines and product policies for connected products, including security and data access policies
* Collaborate with and support internal ASSA ABLOY divisional projects


**Who You Are**
* Driven and enthusiastic about technology
* Entrepreneurial and collaborative
* Agile in leadership and coaching, and an informal leader
* Experienced as a Product Owner within software-focused solutions
* Interested in software technology and business value of modular components and platform features
* Knowledgeable about IoT, software/cloud software development, firmware development, and mobile app development
* Experienced with global teams and matrix organizations
* Proficient in agile methodologies, preferably with experience in SAFe
* Hold an MSc in Computer Science or similar field
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken
* Willing to dive into code and analyze
* Have 5 years of work experience in similar fields


**Why Join Us?**
 This is an exceptional opportunity to join a global leader in the security industry and make a significant impact. You'll work in a dynamic environment with the opportunity to drive innovation and shape the future of smart lock technology.
   

  

**Location**
 This position is based in Stockholm and requires travel between these sites and occasionally throughout the ASSA ABLOY Group.
   

  

**Apply Now**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to join ASSA ABLOY as a Technology Manager IoT. Apply by July 28th, 2024. We review applications regularly, so don’t wait!
   

  

**Contact for More Info:** 
 Anders Wallbom, VP & Head of Technology Solutions, anders.wallbom@assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: HR Generalist
description:
**HR Generalist for Sweden!**
 Are you a service-minded person who values great teamwork? We are looking for someone who
   

 wants to be part of our growing team in Sweden!
   

  

**About us**
 Welcome to the world of Yeppo & Soonsoo - the heart of Baestyle Oy, which beats for Korean
   

 cosmetics and culture. Since 2018, we have acted as a trendsetter by bringing the best beauty
   

 trends and cultural gems from Korea to Finland and all of Europe. Our company's mission is to
   

 promote the innovations and lifestyle of Korean beauty, while supporting the adaptation of our
   

 brands to the needs of local customers. Through our Yeppo & Soonsoo brand, we operate both
   

 in our online store and in our brick-and-mortar stores all over Finland, and now we have
   

 expanded our operations to Stockholm as well.
   

  

 From our selection you can find the best Korean brands such as BBIA, Anua, Ariul, Acropass,
   

 Amuse, Axis-Y, About Tone, Cosnori, Unleashia, Cell Fusion C, SKIN1004, Beauty of Joseon,
   

 Round Lab, Ma:nyo Factory and Abib among others. Our goal is to fulfill our customers' many
   

 wishes with our carefully curated product selection.
   

  

 Welcome to experience the best of Korean beauty and culture with us - at Yeppo & Soonsoo,
   

 where every product tells a story and every customer experience is a journey towards a new
   

 dimension of beauty.
   

  

**Tasks**
 You as an HR generalist will provide advice and support to managers and employees. We answer
   

 by e-mail regarding questions relating to HR-related areas; e.g. issues relating to employees'
   

 employment, salary issues, description of processes and procedures, interpretation of
   

 agreements, regulations and policies, as well as support in HR systems. You will also be a key part
   

 in the recruitment process from the invites, to the interviewing and onboarding. As an HR
   

 Generalist, you will also be involved in developing new processes and standards as we modernise
   

 and digitise HR support within Yeppo in order to contribute to the business in the best possible
   

 way. Work is done remotely, but we wish the HR to go meet the Team once in a while!
   

  

 As an HR generalist, you must have a very high level of service so that managers and employees
   

 feel that it is easy to contact the HR and that they are always close to fast, high-quality
   

 information.
   

  

**What we would like from you**
 -See that you have an education in HR or work experience in HR 2-5years.
   

 -See that you have worked in a service-oriented role.
   

 -Fluent in Swedish and English, both in speech and writing.
   

 -Good knowledge of HR processes and IT systems.
   

 -Helping comes naturally to you and you have good problem solving skills.
   

 -As a person you are positive and have that ”can do” attitude. You are a team player that can
   

 spread great energy and encourage your colleagues.
   

  

**For more information**
 Please contact Jenni Mutkala, HR Manager of Nordics for more information about the position,
   

 hr@yeppo.fi
   

  

**Your application should include a cover letter, CV and referencers.** 
  

  

 You are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than August 18th to hr@yeppo.fi with the title HR24.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
*Founded in 2018, Kreditz is already the market leader in PSD2 credit scoring products.*
*We use Open Banking/PSD2 technology to create our revolutionizing real-time credit scoring products, which are beloved by banks, financial institutions, gambling companies and many more. Kreditz products enable consumers, and businesses, to gain financial inclusion, and financial opportunity where none would be available with traditional credit scoring systems.*
*Our long-term vision "One world, One score" translates into our everyday mission of financial inclusion, and financial opportunity, for everyone around the globe
   

  

 – Everyone deserves a fair assessment.*
*To fuel our growth to the next level, we recently added 10m EUR of funding from world renown investors Creades and Ingka Investments.*
*Come join us on our impactful mission!*
**About The Position**
 Thanks to a continuous three figure growth (+170% FY22 vs FY21) and ambitious expansion plans we are looking to strengthen our organization further with a
 *Cloud Architect* 
 . We are currently entering an exciting phase (startup to scaleup) and expanding our market presence rapidly in the Nordic countries and in Europe. Our clients range from some of Europe’s largest banks and iGaming companies to smaller, innovative businesses.
   

  

**What Can Kreditz Offer**
* One-way ticket to an amazing growth journey you will never forget – A journey where everyone in the team plays a crucial role for our company’s success
* Fun-loving, passionate, and talented colleagues with whom to share small and big company, and personal, milestones and accomplishments
* Humble corporate culture – we celebrate all wins, no matter the size, together!
* 24/7 access to gym/sauna/sports center at our office PLUS additional wellness allowance
* Fixed salary


**Responsibilities**
 Key responsibilities as Cloud Architect at Kreditz:
   

  

* Design and implement scalable and secure cloud architectures that align with business objectives and requirements.
* Evaluate existing cloud infrastructure and make recommendations for improvement and optimization.
* Develop cloud migration strategies and execute the migration of on-premises systems to the cloud.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define cloud-related requirements and provide technical guidance.
* Ensure the security and compliance of cloud environments, implementing necessary controls and monitoring systems.
* Stay up to date with emerging cloud technologies, trends, and best practices.
* Provide guidance and support to development teams in implementing cloud-native solutions.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize cloud initiatives based on business needs.
* Conduct cost analysis and optimization of cloud resources to maximize efficiency and minimize expenses.


**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Cloud Architect to join our IT team at Kreditz. As a Cloud Architect, you will play a critical role in optimizing our cloud services, reducing costs, and improving the performance of our expanding algorithms/logic. You will be responsible for designing and implementing cloud-based solutions, ensuring efficient cloud usage, and staying up to date with industry best practices.
   

  

**Additionally We Believe You Have**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* 3-5 years of experience in Cloud Architect or similar role.
* Proven experience as a Cloud Architect or in a similar role.
* Strong expertise in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* In-depth knowledge of cloud architecture patterns, best practices, and security frameworks.
* Experience with containerization technologies such as Micro-services, Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
* Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English (verbal and written).
* Knowledge of additional European languages can be meritorious.
* Relevant certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect or Azure Solutions Architect are a plus.
* Experience working with FinTech and PSD2 technologies are a plus.


**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**
 Starting date Q3Q4 2023
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Fulltime, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Fixed monthly salary
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company’s CTO
   

  

**WORKPLACE**
 Our office is in Danderyd, Stockholm
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection)
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, COO, Lorenzo@kreditz.com
   

  

 For more information about the role feel free to reach out to our CTO arlen@kreditz.com

title: Senior Manager Electrical, Automation & Industrial Networking Systems,  GB and Nordics
description:
**Senior Manager Electrical, Automation & Industrial Networking Systems, GB and Nordics**
 Within the Engineering and Technology department (E&T) we have the Electrical, Automation, and Industrial Network Systems team (EA&N). We are looking for a Senior Manager Electrical, Automation and Industrial Networking systems to act as a Subject Matter Expert, reporting into the Associate Director of EA&N.
   

  

**What you become part of:**
 The Electrical, Automation & Industrial Networking Systems team is responsible for the development and implementation of the EA&N specifications and standards for equipment installations across the CCEP network.
   

  

**The Team:**
 The EA&N team have four key accountabilities that will drive capability and performance for CCEP, by delivering the best value solutions throughout the total equipment lifecycle:
   

  

* Producing and maintaining EA&N standards, including the obsolescence strategy aligned with OT Cybersecurity and Safety.
* Supporting Manufacturing and Logistics sites, as Subject Matter Expert, to resolve technical issues with EA&N expertise.
* Supporting Capital Project Execution teams and coordination with BPT (IT) departments.
* Supporting the Manufacturing Digital journey at CCEP, working closely with the Digital Transformation department / OT & Digital.


**You will:**
* Support initially mainly the GB and Nordic sites with technical expertise and ensure they apply the CCEP standards technical guidelines. However, the role is central and will be requested to support Western Europe CCEP locations.
* Drive technical solutions when sites and central AssetCare teams are at the end of their technical knowledge with a EA&N technical issue.
* Own 1 or 2 technology expertise areas within the EA&N Technology team (examples could be machine safety, electrical, automation etc.).
* Manage projects when a new concept/prototype equipment is being implemented.
* Work with the capital project execution teams as the EA&N SME to ensure they apply the CCEP standards and technical guidelines.


**What to expect in more detail:**
**Electrical, Automation and Network development and design standards:**
 Medium and Low voltage, Automation devices and its communication from level 0 to level 2, Process and Warehousing Control Systems and OT Network
   

  

* Create and maintain specifications & standards for CCEP Electric, Automation and Industrial Network according to the technology lead assigned. Ensure this knowledge is spread to the business in the form of training.
* Collaborate with the Project Management teams and site operations to ensure the CCEP EA&N equipment specs and RFQs include best practices and learnings.
* Work with Asset Care and Operations teams to develop standard technical documentation packages (e.g. PFDs, Functional Descriptions, Operating Manuals, Maintenance Manuals, OPLs, Commissioning/Qualification/Validation criteria etc.) for EA&N equipment and Installations.
* Connect and influence our supplier base to fulfill CCEP’s current and future investment needs.
* Define appropriate technologies for safe, economic, simple and efficient operation of EA&N equipment. When necessary, with Hygienic design.
* Identify opportunities and develop specific technical solutions to minimize the impact of Obsolescence within EA&N.
* Look externally and benchmark across other industries to identify possible new technologies that could be a good fit for our business.


**Support Production and Logistic sites as EA&N Subject Matter Expert :**
* Follow a clear escalation process within CCEP and with all key vendors to resolve EA&N equipment failures, and work with supplier after-market support when unusual and challenging technical problems are identified.
* Support sites as SME to help drive equipment performance.
* Provide specialist EA&N guidance and support to all stakeholders internally and externally to develop, address and resolve all EA&N technical issues and non-compliances to standards.


**Support Capital Project Execution Teams, Digital Teams and coordination with BPT departments:**
* Work with the capital project teams or Digital Teams in the planning and design phase to ensure that all new installations are designed according to the EA&N standards and engaging BPT teams when necessary.
* Support the capital project teams and site engineering teams with technical expertise throughout the project lifecycle where required.
* When new technologies / designs are being implemented for the first time, take a lead role in managing the execution of said new technology to ensure its successful commissioning and qualification.


**Skills & Experience required:**
**Technical skills:**
* Experience with automation and industrial control systems and an advanced knowledge of industrial automation systems and servo systems.
* Experience with safe, ergonomic, efficient HV/LV infrastructure and electrical installations and an advanced knowledge of electrical components/systems, such as energy meters.
* OT, industrial network and communication systems and a good understanding of cyber security.
* Experience with EU and GB legal regulation requirements
* Experience with solving EA&N technical issues on the factory floor.
* Process control and monitoring systems: SCADA, MES, PLCs, such as Lineview, Ignition, Aveva, WinCC or similar.
* Managing data analysis with Excel and/or PowerBI.
* Experience creating process flows with Visio.
* Automation and Safety controls


**People and Project Management skills:**
* Experience with developing and challenging OEMs to achieve and drive performance, by focusing on automation and user friendly troubleshooting, and always minimizing the risk of higher obsolescence programs.
* Site engineering management and/or engineering project management, where EA&N project budgets were between €0.5 - €2 million.
* Experience with challenging equipment design at the start of the project.
* Experience performing FAT's at OEM factories to ensure Operational and Maintenance requirements are met.
* Experience with supervising the installation, and performing the commissioning of Process Control Systems, working closely with Suppliers to achieve seamless startups.
* Leading and coordinating activities with technicians and Suppliers (Siemens, Aveva, Schneider, B&R etc)
* Experience with developing or supporting suppliers to develop upgrades and improving security on EA&N technology.


**Qualifications Required**
* Engineering degree, preferably in Electrical or Automation; or Engineering degree in New technologies - programming, with demonstrated experience in EA&N.
* Language: Fluent in written and verbal communication English.
* Additional language would be a bonus: German, Spanish and/or French.


**Location**
 Head office based but consider the role is field based on the basis of travelling to and working from the location of active projects or technical support according to demand and business. Preferred location is GB.
   

  

**Travel Required**
 Willing to travel up to 65 % of normal working week including sites and vendors.
   

  

 We would also welcome candidates with less experience for a Manager level position to grow into the team.
   

  

 Please apply with a copy of your CV in English.

title: IT-arkitekt med fokus på övergripande arkitektur
description:
*Har du flerårig relevant yrkeserfarenhet inom arkitekturområdet i ledande befattning samtidigt som du har ett starkt eget driv med vana att utmana existerande modeller?* 
*Vi söker just nu en IT-arkitekt där huvuduppgiften syftar till att vara med och leda arbetet med att använda arkitektur för att vi ska uppnå våra mål att erbjuda digitala tjänster i världsklass till våra kunder och medarbetare.*
*För oss på Länsförsäkringar står digitalisering och hållbarhet högst upp på agendan och med vår omfattande affärsverksamhet, samt dess utbud av produkter och tjänster, så har vi en mängd spännande utmaningar för att säkerställa helhetsperspektivet. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare!*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen som IT-arkitekt kommer du vara en viktig del av Arktiekt-teamet inom Länsförsäkringar Sak vars huvudsakliga syfte är att bidra till strategiska förflyttningar och säkerhetsställa att IT utvecklas i enlighet med våra strategier och affärsmål. Du kommer att ingå i ett team av arkitekter som arbetar nära våra ledare inom verksamhet och IT. Du kommer att vara organiserad i affärsverksamheten Sak och utifrån det jobba verksamhetsövergripande inom Sakförsäkring och med våra Systemarkitekter i våra lean-agila tåg.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter i denna roll är följande:
   

  

* Omsätta Länsförsäkringar Saks strategier och strategiska mål till målbilder och målarkitekturer för IT-landskapet med utgångspunkt från ett verksamhets- och informationsperspektiv.
* Bistå beslutsfattare med strategisk rådgivning.
* Delta och utveckla Länsförsäkringar Saks arkitekturfunktion som består av bland annat Chefs-, informations-, Enterprise-, och IT-arkitekter inom hela Länsförsäkringar AB-koncernen.
* Omvärldsbevaka och följa utvecklingen inom arkitektur för att säkerställa att Länsförsäkringar tar väl underbyggda strategiska inriktningsbeslut.
* Agera som arkitekt i uppdrag och projektets tidiga faser.
* Delta i upphandling av nya system och starta upp arkitekturstyrning inom nya områden.
* Samarbeta nära med affärsutvecklare, EA-arkitekter, tågen och andra affärsenheters arkitekter.


**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framåtstående i denna roll önskar vi att du har följande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Du är en person som har ett starkt eget driv, du har en flerårig relevant yrkeserfarenhet inom arkitekturområdet i ledande befattning och erfarenhet av att utreda, sätta övergripande lösningar och nyttja arkitektur som ett förändringsinstrument.
* Minst 6–8 års erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete inom större företag, med tidigare roller som Enterprise-, affärs/domän-, chefsarkitekt eller motsvarande.
* Relevant akademisk examen (ex. ingenjörsutbildning, civilekonom, systemvetare).
* God förståelse för affär och teknik, med erfarenhet av att ta fram applikations-, integrations- och säkerhetsarkitekturer samt erfarenhet av att vara arkitekt i större projekt och av att utvärdera och köpa in nya system.
* Vi söker dig som har goda analysförmåga, ledaregenskaper och hög kapacitet.


 Meriterande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Kunskap om sakförsäkring.
* Erfarenhet inom försäkring eller finans och kunskaper i lean-agila arbetssätt och SAFe.


 Du kan skapa tydliga och anpassade presentationer för effektiv kommunikation och beslutsfattande. Du kommunicerar bra med både IT-specialister och affärsverksamheten, och du uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt. Du arbetar självständigt och har starkt självledarskap.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Om du vill vara med och driva arkitektur inom sakförsäkringsaffären på Länsförsäkringar och vara en del av vårt arkitektteam och i vår grupp med affärsutvecklare, hållbarhetsansvarig, agilt PMO och coacher för lean-agilt arbetssätt, så är du välkommen att söka tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-12**
 Observera att svarstiden för denna rekryteringsprocess kan vara längre än vanligt, detta på grund av semestertider. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt

title: CRM Specialist
description:
Despite healthcare spending at an all-time high, patient waiting time is getting longer, and patients aren’t accessing the quality of care they deserve. At Kry, we believe we can play a unique role in changing this.
   

  

 As Europe’s leading digital healthcare provider and one of the largest healthcare providers in Sweden, we believe that providing accessible and affordable healthcare has never been more important. Our vision has been consistent and clear: great healthcare for everyone. Do you share our vision and want to be part of shaping the future of healthcare?
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **CRM Specialist** 
 who is agile, curious, solution oriented and committed to detail and accuracy to join our CRM team. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in developing and executing CRM activities across our France and UK markets. This is a very exciting opportunity as you’re joining at a pivotal time - this role will give you the opportunity to grow your skills while getting empowered within a data-driven and creative work environment.
   

  

 What You Will Do
   

  

**Core Responsibilities**
* Play a key role in the development and execution of the CRM strategy
* Coordinate and work closely with the copywriters in each market
* Plan, build and deliver multi-channel communications (emails, push notifications and in-app messages) using our CRM tool Braze
* Fully own our weekly newsletter, including planning and coordinating content with the copywriter and SEO team, building and launching it, monitoring performance and driving improvements
* Actively drive and support the planning and delivery of our ongoing test-and-learn strategy
* Be involved in and coordinate a variety of projects with different business areas
* Manage reports and monitor campaign performance
* Work with Braze and our Martech team to grow our data points within Braze, allowing us to fully leverage the tool and drive initiatives across various user touchpoints
* Assist in quality assurance for our CRM campaigns


 Who You Are
   

  

 If you're passionate about driving customer engagement and leveraging CRM technology, this opportunity is tailored for you. The ideal candidate will bring an enthusiastic "can-do" spirit to the team, pay close attention to details, communicate effectively, and thrive as a collaborative team player.
   

  

**We Are Looking For Someone With**
* 2-3 years of relevant experience working in CRM, building campaigns and automations (Braze is an advantage)
* A good understanding of email and push marketing, CRM metrics, performance management and testing
* Can do attitude with a high attention to detail
* Organised, able to multitask, meet deadlines and adapt to changing environments
* A passion for making marketing communications as relevant to patients as possible, communicating clearly and effectively with consistency
* Team player with strong communication skills
* Experience working in direct campaign set-up and management in a CRM tool
* Keen to challenge current ways of working to improve performance and increase efficiencies
* Fluent in English - Swedish and/or French is an advantage
* The position is full time, based in our Stockholm office.


**Join us and shape your future as well as ours!**
 If you think you’re up to the challenge, come and help us to grow, innovate and develop! A diverse workforce is an absolute necessity for anyone with a vision like ours: to provide great healthcare for everyone. Therefore we celebrate differences and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all employees can truly belong and thrive. We offer a hybrid way of working where we aim to be at our great office at least 3 days a week to cater for a great relationship with our colleagues.
   

  

**About Kry/Livi**
 Kry/Livi is the European leader in digital healthcare, allowing patients to see a doctor, nurse, or psychologist online within minutes. We also combine digital with physical care, transforming how millions of patients access healthcare. Headquartered in Stockholm, we are committed to improving the world’s health through innovation, one patient at a time. In Sweden and Norway we are called Kry. In the UK and France, we operate under the name Livi.
   

  

**Submissions and Questions**
 Please submit your application by including your CV, LinkedIn, GitHub, or Portfolio (where applicable). No submission will be accepted via email, nor when the job posting has become inactive. All applications must go via the careers site or an official Kry / Livi job post.

title: Delivery Lead
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av en IT-driftsorganisation som aktivt bidrar till ett fossilfritt liv inom en generation?
   

  

 Som
 **Delivery Lead** 
 arbetar du på delegering av den linjechef som har störst leverans i en plattformsleverans. En plattformsleverans innebär att flera Business SLA eller tjänster från den tekniska servicekatalogen bakas ihop och erbjuds som en paraplytjänst. Ditt ansvar är att vara sammanhållande mellan alla de enheter som är delaktiga i leveransen.
   

  

 För tjänsten RISE innebär detta att koordinera 13 enheter som levererar tjänster. Arbetet går ut på att se till att alla enheter levererar som de ska, samt stötta och hjälpa till när frågor hamnar mellan stolarna. Du kommer även att ha en tät dialog med servicemanagement och kund. Arbetet kan liknas vid en stor projektleverans utan slut och kräver därför bra ledarskapsförmåga samt bred teknisk kompetens, gärna med kunskap inom alla områden som ingår i leveransen.
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har bred förståelse av IT och drift av datacenter.
* Förstår och anammar högt IT-säkerhetstänk.
* Är driven, tar egna initiativ och är självgående.
* Har ett strukturerat och metodiskt arbetssätt.
* Har god planeringsförmåga.


**Det är meriterande om du har större kompetens eller certifiering inom ett eller flera områden, t.ex.:**
* Projektledare i större projekt.
* Tidigare ledande eller koordinerande roll.


 I den här tjänsten behöver du ha B körkort samt kunna uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska samt engelska i både tal och skrift. Stor fokus kommer att läggas på vilja och ambitionen att utvecklas inom området genom att vara en del av en lärande och utvecklande kultur.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Solna, Ringhals eller Forsmark. I arbetet ingår även ett visst resande främst inom Sverige.
   

  

**För mer information** 
 om själva tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Henrik Lindholm, henrik.lindholm@vattenfall.com För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Carolina Osterman, carolina.osterman@vattenfall.com
   

  

**Fackliga representanter:**
 Akademikerna – Sofi Wadström och Silvija Vatkovic, Ledarna – Christer Gustafsson, SEKO – Juha Siipilehto, Unionen – Inger Strandberg . Du når dem via 08-739 50 00.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 18 augusti 2024.** 
 Urval och intervjuer sker efter sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

 Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.
   

  

 Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid. Vi vill nu göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt inom en generation och vi driver på övergången till ett hållbart energisystem.

title: Business Development Manager IT Security: Sweden
description:
**Why Choose TD SYNNEX:**
 As a Fortune 500 global corporation, operating in over 100 countries, TD SYNNEX values its diverse workforce of 22,000 employees. As the biggest IT distributor in the world, our mission is to provide top-notch technology solutions, empowering businesses and individuals to navigate the digital world safely and efficiently.
   

  

**About the role:**
 Are you a dynamic and results-driven professional with a passion for IT security? We are seeking an experienced Business Development Manager to join our team in Sweden. If you thrive in a dynamic environment, have a proven track record in the IT security industry, and possess excellent communication and relationship-building skills, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Business Development Expertise: identifying and capitalizing on new opportunities within the IT security domain.
* Autonomous Execution: demonstrating a high level of ownership and accountability.
* Influence and Persuasion: develop and maintain strategic relationships that contribute to the growth and success of the business.
* Communication Skills: Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to articulate value propositions clearly.
* Self-Management: Thrive in a dynamic environment by demonstrating the ability to self-manage. Adapt to evolving priorities and navigate challenges with resilience and a proactive mindset.
* Relationship Building: Exhibit skillful relationship-building capabilities, fostering connections at multiple levels.
* Industry Knowledge: Bring a complete understanding of IT security functions, industry best practices, and standards.


**What we're kindly looking for:**
* 4+ years of experience in the IT industry, preferably in business development, or sales.
* Experience with IT Security (Required)
* Proven track record of influencing stakeholders and driving business growth.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* Strong relationship-building skills with a high level of energy and motivation.
* Language requirements: Swedish and English


**What We Offer:**
 We provide competitive compensation with
 **regular annual salary reviews.**
**Hybrid work** 
 - (3 days at the office, 2 days at home)
   

  

 We value continuous learning and provide a clear progression plan.
   

  

 We provide
 **comprehensive benefits** 
 including
 **health insurance** 
 , paid leave, retirement plans, and more.
   

  

**What’s In It For You?**
* Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
* Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
* Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
* Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It’s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
* Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
* Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


**Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.**
 At TD SYNNEX, we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you’re excited about working for our company and believe you’re a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!

title: Sustainability Manager
description:
Do you have solid experience of working with sustainability and climate strategies in the supply chain , with a special focus on climate data management ? Are you interested in sustainability within the food and agriculture sector and want to make a real difference in the value chain, from field to fork? We are now looking for a Sustainability Manager who will play a key role in the ongoing rapid development within sustainable business development in Lantmännen as we are heading for the future.
   

  

**This Is What You Will Do**
 Sustainable business development is the foundation for Lantmännen Group and our members’ long-term profitability. Within the Sustainable Development team at Group Functions, we develop strategies and provide expertise to support Lantmännen’s businesses. As a Sustainability Manager, you will be responsible for driving and coordinating the climate strategy and transition plan for transports and energy within the Group. It includes collecting data from various business units, conducting climate calculations, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and support business improvements. You will collaborate closely with different sectors, supporting operational and business development initiatives related to transport and energy. Success in this role hinges on strong stakeholder collaboration, working actively in a cross-functional and international setting.
   

  

 Additionally, you will contribute to the production of our annual sustainability report, focusing on detailed and accurate transportation calculations. Your expertise will be key in developing internal processes to ensure compliance with new legislation regarding transport and energy. You may also be involved in other sustainability-related projects across the group and various sectors, where your knowledge is needed.
   

  

 In the role, you will report to the Director of Sustainable Development and you will be located at Lantmännen’s headquarters in Stockholm.
   

  

**You Have**
* Previous experience from sustainability work in larger organizations. Preferably from a company with production and logistics.
* Experience in working with climate data management in the value chain. Additional insights into transport calculations are of advantage.
* An academic degree in a relevant field.
* Excellent language skills in Swedish and English, written and oral.
* Experience from the food and/or agriculture sector is considered an advantage.


**You Are**
* An excellent communicator, skilled in building and maintaining relationships in a cross-functional environment, adept at navigating interactions with multiple stakeholders both internally and externally.
* Collaborative and team-oriented. You contribute and share knowledge effectively, employing a pedagogical and coaching approach to support and develop others around you.
* Highly Analytical where you possess a keen attention to detail, essential for the accurate collection, calculation, and interpretation of data, while also understanding its broader implications and developing frameworks
* Experienced in project management where you demonstrate strong organizational and structuring abilities, ensuring efficient management and utilization of data throughout various projects.


 You share our values - Openness, Holistic view, Drive - and our promise of taking responsibility from Field to Fork.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
 We are a large international group with diverse activities throughout the entire grain value chain –from the very sprout in the field to the food on our tables. With a wide range of businesses within food, agriculture, machinery, bioenergy and real estate, we offer career opportunities in every direction across industries, countries, companies and areas of expertise.
   

  

**Sounds interesting?**
 We hope so! You can apply for the position online until the 18th of August . Please note that we are on vacation until the beginning of August, so response times may be slightly longer than usual. We hope you also get the chance to rest and recharge during the summer, and we look forward to returning with renewed energy and continuing the recruitment process.
   

  

 In your application, you have the opportunity to add your CV or LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 For a more objective and inclusive recruitment process, we do not accept personal letters but instead ask you to answer selection questions relevant to the position. The recruitment process includes both psychometric tests and competency-based interviews, with the aim of promoting a fair evaluation for all candidates. At Lantmännen, it is important that everyone has equal opportunities for employment and development within the group.
   

  

 As a final candidate, a background check will be conducted through our supplier ToFindOut . If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, you are warmly welcome to contact Talent Acquisition Manager , J ulia Cau at j ulia . cau @lantmannen.com
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Piping Lead Engineer
description:
**Are you looking for a new challenge as a  Piping Lead Engineer in the consulting industry? Then COWI could be the right place for you! We are looking for candidates with competence in pipe construction and industry who want to further develop their ability in industrial sustainable development and who also have the ability to develop cooperation with our strategic customers. Join us on an exciting development journey towards a green industry with COWI and the Industrial Division!**


  
   

  





  



**SHOW THE WAY FOR DEVELOPMENT IN THE CONSTRUCTION TECHNOLOGY INDUSTRY**






  



 We are currently on a journey towards a greener industry and are now looking for experienced pipe designers who want to be involved and make an impact. The industry is now in an exciting phase with high expectations from our customers with demands for smart systems and energy efficient solutions. In this role, you become part of our team and you work in close collaboration with leading project engineers, employees and customers. Your most important task in the team is to contribute knowledge within the civil engineering discipline in our industrial customers' projects. Most often, the projects are multidisciplinary and include complete delivery (EPC), which leads to varied and developing tasks within the discipline.
   

  







  

  



**WHO WE THINK YOU ARE**





* Has a technical education in pipe construction, preferably with an engineering degree
* Many years of experience working with pipe construction in industry
* Very good knowledge of drawing programs such as E3D
* Very good knowledge of industry standards
* Very good ability to solve technical problems and deliver high quality solutions
* Very good ability to collaborate and communicate with customers and colleagues



  



 We attach great importance to personal suitability and believe that you are a driven and responsible person who wants to be part of our organization and its development. If you think you are the person we are looking for, do not hesitate to submit your application today. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  







  



 Our employees are our greatest asset: it is our employees who make the projects successful. At COWI, you get a unique opportunity to learn from the best and develop your potential, and you get to participate in shaping the society of the future. Together with your manager, you set up a plan for your own development, and you get the opportunity to build on your expertise in both local and global projects from day to day.
   

  







  

  
   

  





  



**YOUR COMPETENCE. OUR TEAM. TOGETHER WE SHAPE THE FUTURE**






  



 Your competence is the key to our success. We work across disciplinary boundaries and within various business areas where we share our knowledge and build strong relationships with customers and colleagues. You contribute your expertise while having the opportunity to learn from the best.
   

  







  

  
   

  





  



**COME AND WORK WITH US**






  



 The building and construction department consists of approx. 60 employees. Within the department, pipe designers, building designers, calculation engineers and system administrators work with facility planning for various types of industrial and energy facilities. Our largest customers operate in petrochemicals/refineries, energy plants and paper and pulp.
   

  







  



 Through our expertise, we support the customer in achieving today's industry standards. Most of the time, our work involves a total commitment where we are involved in all stages from pre-study, preliminary design, detailed design and procurement to construction management, control and final inspection.
   

  







  

  
   

  





  



**DO YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS?**






  



 Then you can call Jonas Johnsson in Gothenburg, Head of Section, Mobile: +46 70 654 4703
   

  







  



 For Karlstad you can call Per Andersson, Head of Section, Mobile: prae@cowi.com
   

  







  

 Andreas Ekeblad, Group Manager, Stenungsund at tel. 010 850 24 86.
   

  





  

  
   

  





  



**EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL**






  



 At COWI, we value equal opportunities for all employees and applicants based on individual circumstances without regard to gender, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, or age.
   



  
   

  





  



 #ChallengeAccepted

title: Patient Journey Manager - Rare Disease (Sweden)
description:
**Overview**
 Patient Journey Manager – Rare Disease (Sweden)
   

  

 Remote position in Sweden
   

  

**LIVING OUR PURPOSE TO MAKE PEOPLE SMILE**
 At Kyowa Kirin International (KKI), our purpose is to make people smile. This means more than drug discovery and development; it is about embedding care into everything we do to make a difference every day for those that need it most. We are an inclusive pharmaceutical company that takes the time to understand what really matters to our patients, their families, and their healthcare professionals, helping our people to take bold actions that deliver life-changing solutions sooner. Our culture is rooted in our values: Teamwork, Commitment to Life, Innovation, and Integrity. They help us to push boundaries to deliver extraordinary impact and make KKI such a special place to work.
   

  

**The opportunity:**
 Are you passionate about meeting the needs of people living with rare diseases as they journey through the often long and difficult road to diagnosis and long-term care? Have you worked with Healthcare Professionals (HCPs) and the medical industry to help ensure a true patient-focused approach, perhaps in a hospital setting, a field-based Medical or Commercial role, or potentially a patient engagement, marketing or patient services role? Are you looking for an opportunity that lets you help build the future direction of a company, giving input and adapting our approach as we build a team of Patient Journey Managers (PJMs)? If so, this might be the role for you.
   

  

 At KKI, we recently re-organised our field-based teams into a new structure. Our team of PJMs is the primary point of contact and face of our company to Healthcare Professionals, and as such, the PJMs play a critical role in helping to shape the future of patient care at KKI. If you are patient oriented, eager to be part of building something of significance within our company, and able to build strong relationships across multiple teams and stakeholders, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Job purpose:**
 You will be the face of KKI, as primary point of contact for HCPs and associated stakeholders. A field based omnichannel conductor, with in depth knowledge of the entire patient journey, focused on delivering a personalised, high value customer experience, enhancing the patient journey, building partnerships with internal and external stakeholders, improving outcomes and optimising the impact of KKI products to the benefit of patients aligned with our mission to make people smile.
   

  

 You'll need to maintain a high level of activity, targeting specific groups, foster relationships with key stakeholders, and deliver on business and sales targets in your geographical area. Collaborating with marketing and medical departments to support regional and national engagements is crucial.
   

  

 Analysing regional sales data, prioritising resources effectively and implementing patient-focused solutions are key responsibilities. Engaging with key stakeholders, identifying new opportunities, addressing access hurdles, and sharing key business insights with the organisation are also part of your role.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Position Requirements:**
* LIF exam
* Experience within field Medical or Commercial roles, preferrable in rare disease
* Stakeholder management experience as well as cross functional collaboration
* Digital experience (multichannel engagement, including over Teams, email, webinars)
* Knowledge of local, regional, and national health systems and care delivery processes is a must
* Being proactive, having strong implementation skills, and a marketing/commercial mindset are important
* Being a team player able to build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders
* Excellent local language required
* Proficiency in English and computer skills such as Microsoft Office, CRM systems
* Willingness to travel and a valid driver’s license is essential


 Kyowa Kirin International is an equal opportunities employer
 **.**
**No agencies please**

title: Brand Manager Wella Care & Styling Northern Europe
description:
**Brand Manager Wella Care & Styling Northern Europe** 




 Stockholm, Sweden / Rotterdam, Netherlands
 



  
 



 Do you want to work for one of the world’s leading global beauty companies?
 



 Would you like a dynamic, entrepreneurial and international work environment?
 



 Are you analytical and like coordinating between departments and across countries? Are you structured even if the tempo is high? Do you think outside of the box to grow your business? Then you could be the person we are looking for to strengthen our Wella Company team in Northern Europe.
 



  
 



 As a major actor of the beauty sector, Wella is a >140 years old company loved and recognized by its customers & consumers for the inspiration and the excellence it has consistently released to the hairdressing market over the past decades. Its portfolio is composed of iconic brands such as Wella Professionals, Sebastian Professional, Sassoon Professional, System Professional, NIOXIN, ghd, OPI and Kadus Professional.
 



  
 



**ABOUT THE JOB** 




 As Brand Manager, you will play a vital role in ensuring the success and performance of Wella Professionals Care & Styling brands. Your role is to develop and execute brand strategies across our six Northern European markets for your brands within the Wella Portfolio.
 



 You will work closely with the headquarters in Geneva and with the cross-functional teams to develop and execute strategic marketing initiatives that effectively position our brand in the market. The role reports to the
 



 Head of Marketing Development Northern Europe.
 



 Monitoring marketing trends and analyzing internal and competitor activities will be integral parts of your responsibilities to ensure we maintain a competitive edge.
 



  
 



  
 



**Your key job responsibilities:** 



* **Brand ownership:** 
 You will have full ownership of brand performance and P/L. This includes managing the marketing budget and investment choices and annual price setting.
* **Brand Strategy Development** 
**:** 
 Collaborate to develop comprehensive brand strategies aligned with company objectives and target audience preferences.
* **Launch Execution:** 
 Collaborate to plan and execute product and commercial initiative launches for Wella Care & Styling.
* **Marketing Campaign Execution** 
 : Plan and execute marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media, print, and events, to enhance brand visibility and engagement.
* **Omnichannel management:** 
**Assure all channels are aligned and build the brands in the same way. Working with a selective amount of customers to maximize brand visibility.**
* **Market Research and Analysis:** 
 Conduct market research to identify consumer trends, preferences, and competitive landscape. Analyse data to make informed decisions and recommendations for brand positioning and messaging.
* **Data analysis:** 
 Analyze sales data to uncover opportunities to further grow the business
* **Sales Cycle development:** 
 Work with the team to develop compelling brand messaging and activation for the quarterly sales cycle of the professional salon channel.
* **Content Creation and Management** 
 : Content creating and managing content for various marketing materials, including website copy, social media posts, email campaigns, and advertising materials.
* **Collaboration with Cross-Functional Teams** 
 : Collaborate with multifunctional commercial teams on you brand plans – including Trade Marketing, Education, Sales, Supply, PR & Comms, Paid, Influencer and any other teams to ensure brand consistency and alignment across all touchpoints.
* **Performance Monitoring and Reporting:** 
 Track and analyze the performance of marketing initiatives and campaigns. Prepare regular reports to evaluate the effectiveness of branding efforts and identify areas for improvement.
* **People management** 
 : There will be an intern reporting to you.



  
 



  
 



**WHO ARE YOU:** 




 We are looking for a self-motivated individual with energy, enthusiasm and a dedication to succeed.  You will be given responsibility from the start and will be expected to take charge and make things happen.  
 



  
 



 You:
 


* Are a curious individual, with a passion for beauty and able to make complex decisions using all data available, but comfortable enough to use gut feeling and instinct when these are missing.
* Can work with a very diverse group with different professional and cultural backgrounds, turning them into an effective and powerful team.
* Are an engaged leader who has the capacity to cope with short term challenges, while keeping the end vision well ahead of them.
* Have a strong understanding of marketing principles and branding strategies.
* Have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Use your analytical, technical and leadership skills to act as the entrepreneur of your own brands – you enjoy being accountable for results while having the freedom on how to deliver them.
* Have experience with digital marketing, e-commerce business and omnichannel strategies.
* Are highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Are creative with a strategic mindset to challenge status quo.
* Have a minimum of 3 years relevant work experience in marketing, brand management or a similar role
* Are fluent in English – both spoken and written. One of the languages in the cluster is also valued but not a criteria.
* Have a master´s degree in business or equivalent.



 To succeed in this role you need to have the ambition to go beyond the expected and be based in the Stockholm or Rotterdam area
 



  
 



**WHAT WE OFFER YOU** 



* We offer attractive promotional offers and a career in an innovative and successful company.
* An exciting role with varying tasks.
* Engaged and driven colleagues in an international environment.



**EEO OPPORTUNITIES** 



* We offer equal employment opportunity to qualified individuals without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Wella Company with federal and state disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact us at: https://www.wellacompany.com/consumer-affairs
* We strongly believe that cultivating a diverse workplace gives a company strength. The combination of unique skills, abilities, experiences and backgrounds creates an environment that produces extraordinary results. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled.
