title: Manager People Engagement Nordics – Fixed term contract 12 months
description:
At PMI, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future.
   

  

 Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and have been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years, and together we are working to deliver a smoke-free Nordic by 2035.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Manager People Engagement who will be part of our Nordic People & Culture Department.
   

  

 Role summary:
   

  

 Joining as the Manager People Engagement means assuming a critical position that involves delving into the experiences of our employees in Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland. Under the leadership of the Director People & Culture Nordics, you will lead the development and implementation of a comprehensive internal engagement and communication strategy, aimed at enhancing employee engagement, fostering a strong sense of belonging, and advocacy for the company. Key areas to focus on in creating such a strategy include employee listening, Diversity, Equity Inclusion (DEI) and change management.
   

  

 This role is for a defined duration of 12 months.
   

  

 Main accountabilities:
   

  

**Employee Experience Action Planning**
* Run local employee listening activities, enable leaders to drive culture of employee listening and upskill them in working with engagement data and action planning.
* Work with available data across the whole employee journey, both quantitative and qualitative and from various sources, to translate it to validated insights.
* Trigger and facilitate end to end action planning cycle, ensuring that identified priority areas are being addressed and progress is being measured.
* Lead projects with engagement/communication focus, to address employee needs.


 INTERNAL COMMUNICATION
   

  

  

* Define Nordic wide comprehensive & strategic internal communication plan, covering both business needs and employee experience action points, and aligned to global themes of Global Communications, Global I&D and Global Employee Experience.
* Drive the plan´s execution, taking various audiences into account and working in close collaboration with the leadership teams.
* Develop and maintain local communications infrastructure and platform strategy, advise business on audience segmentation, channel strategy, and messaging for business communication needs.


 CHANGE MANAGEMENT
   

  

  

* Lead assigned change management initiatives, leveraging global toolkit; advise business partners and line managers on change management tools and approaches.


 Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI)
   

  

  

* Plan and coordinate the local Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) strategy to drive the global DEI agenda and deploy initiatives to create an inclusive, safe and empowering culture.
* Lead full audit cycles of I&D certifications (e.g. Equal salary certification).


 Who we are looking for:
   

  

  

* University degree in business administration, Communications, Public Relations, HR Management, Inclusion & Diversity Management
* 3-5 years of professional experience with proven records in Communications, Inclusion & Diversity or Change Management
* Experience in deriving action from insights & translating these into engagement and communication formats
* Experience working across multiple levels, functions and regions; able to deliver message effectively across various formats
* Experience and success in leading projects and project teams
* Proactive and passionate about driving best-in-class employee experience by deriving actions through insights
* Team oriented – ability to work well with diverse, cross-functional teams
* Strong writing skills in both Swedish and English
* Strong storytelling, partnering and change management abilities
* Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communications skills
* Comfortable advising senior management team members


 What we offer
   

  

 Our success depends on the dedicated people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join PMI and you too can:
   

  

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy flexibility of hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.

title: Butikschef
description:
**Butikschef till Twilfit by Change Ringen, Stockholm**
 Är du en resultatinriktad ledare som kan utveckla och motivera ditt team till att nå försäljningsframgångar, då är Twilfit by Change din nästa arbetsplats!
   

  

 Vi letar efter en butikschef som är driven, engagerad och kan coacha sina medarbetare till att skapa förstaklassig köpupplevelse för våra kunder. Som Butikschef på Twilfit by Change kommer du att vara en viktig del av vårt uppdrag, att hjälpa våra kunder att känna sig bekväma och vackra i våra underkläder, oavsett storlek.
   

  

 På Twilfit by Change inser vi att det är våra duktiga Butikchefer, som genom sitt dagliga engagemang skapar värde för både våra kunder, medarbetare och företaget. Därför är det också helt naturligt att du som Butikchef får del av det resultat som du skapar.
   

  

**KAN DU LEDA, SÄLJA OCH SKAPA EN BRA ATMOSFÄR?**
 Vi söker dig som är framgångsrik i din roll som Butikschef eller ledare från en liknande position. Du har skapat dina resultat genom att motivera och inspirera ditt team med din personlighet och genom att visa dem vägen.
   

  

 Vi förväntar oss att du:
   

  

* Drivs av att skapa resultat både genom dina medarbetare, men också genom dina egna insatser.
* En erfaren ledare som kan coacha och inspirera för utveckla medarbetarna till att nå sina egna och butikens mål.
* Mycket duktig på att ge goda råd till dina kunder – en förmåga du har fått från positioner inom kundservice, försäljning eller liknande.
* Är en person med positiv energi och med omtanke om kunden vilket gör att du kan skapa en bekväm miljö i intima situationer.
* Som butikchef förväntar vi oss att du tar det fulla ansvaret för butikens dagliga verksamhet så att butiksmålen kan uppnås.


**DU HAR ERFARENHET AV:**
* Personalplanering och optimal schemaläggning. .
* Du har förmågan att skapa lönsamhet genom analys och handlingsplan och detta kommer att synas i din P&L.
* Ledning och coachning av dina medarbetare.
* Säljträning
* Uppfylla dagliga försäljnings- och KPI-mål
* Se till att butikens uttryck alltid följer gällande riktlinjer.
* Administrativa uppgifter och håller alla deadlines
* Dialog med huvudkontoret


**VAD KAN DU FÖRVÄNTA DIG AV OSS?**
 På Twilfit by Change är vi mycket fokuserade på din framgång, eftersom vi vet att framgången för vår verksamhet beror på dina resultat. Därför kan du förvänta dig en grundlig rekryteringssprocess, vi vill göra en så bra matchning som bara möjligt. Du kommer att få en ordentlig ombording, så att du är utrustad för att driva din butik framgångsrikt och leverera de förväntade resultaten. Du kommer även att få ett brett utbud av stöd och service, såsom HR rådgivning, rapporter, budgetar, IT lösningar, som hjälper dig i ditt dagliga arbete så att du kan fokusera på försäljning och coacha dina medarbetarna. Förutom en fast lön, har du möjlighet att få bonus och därmed uppnå vinstdelning i förhållande till de resultat du skapar. På Twilfit by change förväntar vi oss att du driver butiken som om den vore din "egen". I gengäld erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att få ta del av 25-50% av butikens vinst. Du kan förvänta dig att spela en viktig roll i ett ambitiöst och framgångsrikt företag.
   

  

**ÄR DU REDO FÖR FÖRÄNDRING?**
 Skynda dig och skicka en ansökan genom att klicka på "ansök". Vi håller regelbundna intervjuer för tjänsten, så ansök idag snarare än imorgon.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Tatjana Jovanovic, tatjov@change.com
   

  

*Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!*

title: Bli vår nya IT-support tekniker !
description:
**ÄR DU REDO FÖR NÄSTA STEG I DIN IT-KARRIÄR?**
 Vi söker engagerade och kunniga IT-supporttekniker med 1–2 års erfarenhet inom 1st line-support eller helpdesk. Bli en del av vårt dynamiska team där samarbete, gemenskap och personlig utveckling står i fokus!
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Personer som trivs i denna konsultroll, gillar att ha ansvar för installation, support och felsökning av lokal IT-utrustning. Du kommer även att samarbeta nära med den lokala IT-driften för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och snabbt åtgärda eventuella problem för användarna.
   

  

 Tänk dig ett jobb där du får möjligheten att testa många olika områden inom IT eller att hitta din spetskompetens och arbeta med den senaste tekniken. Ett jobb som ger dig goda förmåner, trygghet, ett stort nätverk samt utvecklingsmöjligheter. Här får du vara en del av en stark gemenskap som värdesätter ditt välmående och karriärsutveckling.
   

  

**OM DIG**
**Krav:**
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av IT-support via telefon, chatt och e-post.
* Teknisk kompetens inom Active Directory.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 och Microsoft Office i Windows.
* Färdighet i användning av ServiceNow eller liknande ärendehanteringssystem.
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift.


**VI SER GÄRNA ATT DU ÄR**
 Skicklig på att samarbeta och bygga goda relationer, beslutsam och målinriktad även i utmanande situationer, samt engagerad i att arbeta för teamets framgång och gemensamma mål. Det är även meriterande om du kan flytande engelska i tal och skrift!
   

  

 Vi värdesätter en arbetsmiljö där varje medarbetare blir uppskattad. Om du är en person som gillar gemenskapen, det sociala samt älskar att lösa problem och bidra till teamets framgång, vill vi höra från dig! Ansök nu och bli en del av vårt inspirerande team.
   

  

**VI ERBJUDER**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på Wise IT blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får kollegor runt om i Sverige på alla regionala Wise IT kontor och även med våra andra konsulter som sitter ute på uppdrag hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stötta dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver.
   

  

 Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!
   

  

*Wise IT arbetar med kompetensförsörjning inom IT. Vår uppgift är att hitta rätt person till rätt IT-jobb, genom rekrytering och konsulter. Vi tror på människan i en framtida teknikutveckling och brinner för att bygga relationer, inkludera fler i IT-branschen och naturligtvis matcha rätt kompetens till rätt uppdrag. Vi vill vara en självklar go-to career partner oavsett om kandidaten söker jobb i dagsläget eller inte. Vill du vara med på vår resa? Läs mer om oss, vår kultur och våra värderingar på vår karriärsida.*
 ANSÖKAN
   

  

 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Då många är på ledighet under sommaren så kan svarstiden dröja på ansökan. Vi kommer successivt att gå igenom ansökningarna när ansvarig rekryterare är tillbaka från semestern.
   

  

 Ha en underbar sommar önskar vi på Wise IT 🍓

title: Sales Associate-Nordic Region
description:
**About Northern Trust**
 Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
   

  

 Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm and has primary support for the sales manager in location and ad-hoc support to the rest of the EMEA team.
   

  

 The Sales Associate will support the EMEA Sales Team in achieving annual targets by focusing on business development.
   

  

 A key responsibility for this role includes producing the weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting that is required.
   

  

**Additional Responsibilities Include**
* Targeting new business from Pensions, Insurance, Corporate/ Baking, OCIO/ Fiduciary Management, Traditional Asset Management and Alternative Asset Management sectors.
* Maintaining up to date market research of target markets/sectors.
* Supporting the RFP (Request for Proposal) and sales teams to gather accurate information from the business and reviews RFP responses to ensure it is customised to prospects needs.
* Supporting the preparation of commercials and following fee review process.
* Liaising with other SMEs (Subject Matter Experts) across Northern Trust to support RFP responses, gather FTE requests and work with Deal Manager to prepare for due diligence preparation
* Maintaining up to date market research of target markets/sectors and research new markets/sectors of interest to Northern Trust.
* Researching prospect profile and work alongside sales managers on key deals to build value propositions specific to each prospect.
* Managing and preparing the fee model/proposals for EMEA sales and ensure that all required supporting documentation is in place and regularly checked for updates.
* Ensuring that the fee review process is strictly adhered to.
* Supporting and coordinating all aspects relating to sales presentations such as presentation booklets, supporting sales collateral, agendas, etc.
* Supporting the Deal Manager for due diligence preparation.
* Maintaining up-to-date client data within CRM databases, keep accurate records, support call report completion/filing and run periodic reports as required.
* Producing sales reports on a regular and ad hoc basis as required by senior management. Collaborating with the US Sales Team on global reporting and initiatives.
* Analysing prospect data to assist sales team focus on target markets/prospects, differentiators and product gaps.
* Developing a working knowledge of the products that Northern Trust offer, attending product and training sessions.


 The preferred candidate should have a fair amount of the following qualities:
   

  

* Strong numerate and literacy skills.
* Knowledge of financial products and services and basic sales concepts usually obtained through related work experience or formal education
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and intermediate skills in PowerPoint.
* Good communication skills: written, verbal and non-verbal to interact with stakeholders/clients.
* Demonstrated ability to work well under pressure and work to tight deadlines.
* Strong level of attention to detail and time management.
* Strong analytical and organizational skills.
* Demonstrated ability to prioritize daily workloads, working efficiently and accurately under pressure.
* To act with integrity at all times and embrace the philosophy of treating customers fairly
* Demonstration of initiative, accountability and focus on quality


**Working With Us**
 As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.
   

  

 Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.
   

  

 We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater
   

  

**Reasonable accommodation**
 Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com.
   

  

 We hope you’re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.
   

  

 Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
ADB SAFEGATE is a company that provides integrated solutions to airports, airlines, and ANSPs.  

  



We are proud to be leading the way with innovative and smart Airside 4.0 solutions that turn airports into smart airports, with the ultimate goal of enhancing the passenger experience. Solutions include airfield lighting, power and control systems, airport and tower software, docking automation, apron management, and aftermarket services.  



  

With over 1,400 employees and over 2,500 airports in over 175 countries, from the busiest and largest to the fastest-growing airports, ADB SAFEGATE is dedicated to making air travel safe, efficient, and environmentally friendly.  



  

To learn more about ADB SAFEGATE and our innovative Airside 4.0 solutions, please visit our website at adbsafegate.com.


We are ADB SAFEGATE. Our purpose is to lead the world in smart solutions to handle more aircraft and passengers safely, sustainably and efficiently at airports around the globe.

**POSITION**


Job Title: Full Stack Engineer


Location: Malmö, Sweden


Contract type: Permanent


Business Line: Providing the most extensive product and service portfolios, where the airfield, apron, tower and terminal are the foundation for fully integrated solutions to support airport development and optimize operational procedures.

 **The opportunity**


Bring your passion for Aviation and joy of meeting people all around the world as we build our Aviation developer experience. ADB SAFEGATE is a global company with a drive to help airports operate more efficiently, safely and environmentally friendly. Support our vision to change the future of aviation and join our expansion around the APRON Business line as we fly on to our next adventure.

* Driven by customer: you bring success to our customers when designing, specifying, and implementing system solutions while considering functionality, data, security, integration, infrastructure and performance.
* Setting the bar high: You push for better when you develop maintain and improve the overall architecture.
* Own it: When being involved in development of the entire system, you have a solve it attitude and deliver in time.
* Together we win: you want to work in an organization where you, together with your team, want to build structure, develop and influence our methods. You play to win by investigating new possible technologies to fulfil to the organization’s business needs.
* Inspiring talent: you want to work in an open climate where you recognize achievements and provides feedback to inspire people to grow.

  

The position is located in Malmö, Sweden. We have a Hybrid workplace and flexible working hours and are now building more possibilities for development. We have a relatively small R&D team in Malmö where colleagues support each other on a daily basis. The team in Malmö work close with our colleague in Graz, Austria.

  

We want to see our people grow and therefore we believe in accountability and trust.

 **You will make an impact by**


As a Full Stack Engineer in our R&D team, you will report to the R&D Managers of our APRON Business and focus on design and development of our Angular/NodeJS applications. This role provides a fantastic opportunity to work with colleagues and customers around the world and experience many different cultures.


The ideal candidate is a Full Stack Engineer who is a team player with a “we solve it” attitude. You will succeed by leveraging your Typescript and data layer interfaces skills, applying an interculture mindset and continue your development in functional software design.

 **The talent we want to inspire has**

* Experience in DevOps, Continuous Integration and Delivery which is the drive in all our software development, to get the quick feedback from our internal and external customers.
* Experience as a frontend developer working in Typescript (Angular preferred). We work in this way aligned within the organization to be able to support each other and to share knowledge and experience.
* Experience with microservice architecture (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.) We and several of our customers is doing this journey now to be strong in our offer.
* It is important that you have experience working with collaboration software (e.g. Azure DevOps, Jira, Confluence, Git etc.).
* Fluent English skills

 **This would be a plus but not a must!**

* Experience working in an international, multicultural, and entrepreneurial environment
* Knowledge in agile software development
* Fluent Swedish skills

 **What's on offer**


We value you and your contribution in the business. Recognizing and rewarding the impact you make is important to us.

* In return we offer a competitive salary/ benefits
* The opportunity to develop your career. We love to upskill and promote our staff; there's nothing better than to see someone gain a strong sense of pride and accomplishment.
* A great flexible working culture with company values and behaviours that help shape your development and lead to success for you and the Company.
* An international environment with opportunities to collaborate with colleagues in different countries around the globe.

  

If you want to join a global business and enjoy being a team player who's driven and passionate, then this is your opportunity to come on board by applying!


What to learn more about working at ADB SAFEGATE then check out our Career's website


https://adbsafegate.com/about/career/
company_description: ADB SAFEGATE is a company that provides integrated solutions to airports, airlines, and ANSPs.

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
**Role:**  

We are looking for a Senior Test Automation Engineer/Test Automation Lead!

title: Client Director
description:
**We seek candidates inspired by an ambitious growth agenda. Take the opportunity to join Learnster on our trailblazing journey to reshape the future of workplace individual learning!**
 Learnster is a cutting-edge learning management system committed to revolutionizing how organizations approach employee development. Our human-centered approach blends innovative technology and AI with a dedication to empowering individuals and fostering learning cultures. Learnster comprises 45 engaged individuals, 200+ customers, and users across 30+ countries. Join us on our trailblazing journey to reshape the future of workplace individual learning!
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Client Director you will play a crucial role in expanding the company's client base and driving significant revenue growth. You will also maintain and enhance relationships with existing key accounts, ensuring their continued satisfaction and exploring opportunities for account expansion.
   

  

 We expect you to be a self starter, with a strong drive and interest in client interactions. The role requires a strategic approach to identify and engage potential clients, understand their needs, and develop tailored solutions that align with their business objectives.
   

  

 You are expected to take responsibility for, and ownership of, a annual sales quota of approx. 5 MSEK in net new revenue.
   

  

**Your role will mainly include**
* Prospecting: Identify and cultivate relationships with potential clients, understanding their needs and business challenges.
* Sales and Revenue Generation: Lead the sales process from prospecting to closing, focusing on creating new revenue opportunities.
* Client Relationship Management: Maintain strong relationships with existing clients, ensuring satisfaction and exploring opportunities for account growth.
* Negotiate agreements of own deals: Negotiate and sign contracts with customers and secure hand over to Customer Success.
* Keep records of own sales fulfillment and data reporting: To continuously work and keep the CRM system updated at company, contact and deal level. Also work efficiently with templates, sequences and reporting.


**To thrive in this role you have**
**Educational Background**
* A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Sales, or a related field or relevant experience.


**Professional Experience**
* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in a sales, business development, or account management role, with a proven track record in new client acquisition and revenue generation.
* Experience in managing and growing key accounts, with a focus on both client retention and expansion.
* Demonstrated success in negotiating and closing deals, preferably in a similar industry or market. Preferably SaaS B2B in HR Tech.


**What We Offer**
* An exciting journey in a scale-up with strong investors
* Flexible work arrangements (remote/on-site)
* Health and wellness benefits
* Continuous learning opportunities within a vibrant, innovative team
* Six weeks of paid vacation plus 3 extra free days per year
* A culture that values diversity and promotes personal development


**We look forward to meeting you!**
* Join a fast-growing and awarded SaaS company, where you will play a key role in shaping Learnster’s future.
* At Learnster, you will work with passionate and ambitious colleagues, ready to take ourselves, our team, and the company to the next level!

title: Business Development Director – HCM for the NORDICS region
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
**Business Development Director – HCM for the NORDICS region**
 Our business development team plays a pivotal role in helping customers make well-informed decisions at the outset of their digital transformation. We achieve this by providing a world-class engagement experience. Our responsibilities include building and maturing a pipeline of sales opportunities and driving incremental revenue in collaboration with Sales, Presales, Alliance & Channels, and Marketing teams. We focus on prospecting existing and new accounts, while nurturing leads into fully qualified opportunities.
   

  

**Purpose of the role:** 
 drive and accelerate pipeline creation for
 **Oracle HCM Cloud solutions** 
 , by improving account penetration in the
 **Nordics region (Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, Iceland)** 
 and by developing relationships across the business. Identify and push forward our new opportunities.
   

  

**Description**
* The Role is customer facing.
* His/her mission is to lead & drive account-based pipe generation activities in selected, strategic accounts across all industries.
* Identify customer needs and create net new opportunities.
* Nurture & progress leads/pursuits to pipe to Sales Stage 3 opportunities.
* Product Scope of the role: Oracle HCM Cloud + HCM analytics applications.
* The Bus Dev Director will be able to position Oracle HCM, our strategy and competitive differentiators, at the earliest stages of the sales cycle.
* He/she will build relationships at all levels, with a focus on CHROs/HR leaders.
* He/she will work hand in hand with the Account Executives during the first stages of an opportunity.
* He/she will collaborate with the extended sales team: Value Engineering, Solution Engineers, Marketing, Business Development Specialists and with Oracle partners.


**Skill Profile**
* 10+ years of expertise in the HR industry, ideally with a corporate / HR leadership role.
* Good presentation skill
* HR expertise - C-level advisor / influencer
* Understanding of end-to-end / HR business + deep knowledge of one of the following Industries – Manufacturing, Retail, Financial Services, Healthcare or Public Sector
* Builds, creates, and nurtures strong relationships with customers.
* Ability to articulate a compelling HCM value proposition to Execs / Board and all levels at the customer.
* Provides thought leadership in customer engagements, as speaker at events and on social media
* ���Hunter” mindset and curiosity.


**Stakeholders**
 The Business Development Director will leverage marketing, business development initiatives and
   

  

 programs, industry content and existing Alliance and Channel relationships in the account to succeed.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define Account Strategy & Planning with the Account Executives
* Take ownership and execute based on the agreed plan with the Account Executives.
* Increase contacts base in each account.
* Discover customers challenges, needs and opportunities with assigned, strategic accounts.
* Ensure a deep understanding of business & HR processes and challenges.
* Advise customers on HR digital transformation
* Ensure a deep knowledge of Oracle’s main competitors, especially in the HCM field.
* Strategic and transformational deal support.
* Support the Account Executives in the execution of their strategy.
* Develop the appropriate coverage and knowledge for each account at HQ and Subsidiary level.


**KPIs**
* Pipeline creation for HCM solutions
* Coverage: work towards always having required coverage for the Sales Reps/team to achieve HCM sales/growth targets
* # of deals that successfully progress from lead/early sales stage to sales stage 3+
* Increase pipeline and revenue at the country level


**Competencies**
* Subject matter expert in Human Resources with a minimum of 10 years of experience.
* Understanding of the competitive landscape
* Ability to talk to CHROs, but also CFOs, CPOs, CIOs, COOs, practitioners and experts in customers, consulting companies and partners on a peer-to-peer basis
* Business development and/or Sales experience


**Professional & Personal Competencies**
* Educated to degree level.
* Opportunity and customer focus, results orientation.
* Project management skills.
* Building relationships & communication.
* Influencing and negotiating.
* Decision making.
* Coaching.
* Fluency in Swedish and English. Additional knowledge of languages is a plus (Danish, Norwegian and/or Finnish)
* Ability to travel frequently in the Nordics region (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Iceland).


**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Career Level - IC4
   

  

 A Business Development Representative is assigned to strategic accounts which may be grouped by industry where Oracle has a limited presence. Acts as primary liaison between Consulting, Sales, and Oracle Development for the product's sales opportunities. Generates business opportunities through prospecting mass market programs and leveraging third party partners. Develops and coordinates a worldwide relationship with customers that establishes Oracle as a preferred vendor and optimizes Oracle's sales of product. Executes aggressive strategies and plans to successfully drive the product as the preferred customer selection. Provides account representatives with information on how the product addresses specific needs, and assists account representatives in using Oracle's products to leverage large revenue opportunities. Assists in articulating product message, coordinates technical resources and hands off deals to a successful close.
   

  

 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Technical Specialist - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Are you a curious and engaged Technical Specialist and want to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!
   

  

 We are looking for a Technical Specialist who wants to be part of Tietoevry Tech Services. Tietoevry Tech Services drives enterprise-wide transformation across customers’ business processes, applications, and infrastructure.
   

  

**When joining** 
**Tietoevry Tech Services as a Technical Specialist:**
* You join a skilled team of technical specialist and solution architects, where you learn new things with your colleagues.
* You will take part of daily operations, focusing on the lifecycle management and service architecture of our Vmware virtual environment.
* Tasks such as planning upgrades, performance and capacity analyze, regular and ad-hoc reporting towards both internal product management as well as towards customer teams.
* Our agile delivery model means that you will participate in several projects at the same time, which requires the ability to collaborate and prioritize.
* Planning and designing our new onshore/restricted VMware environment as architect role.


**Who we are looking for:**
* You have a university degree in a relevant field or relevant competence, combined with several years of work experience and background in VMWare / virtualization environment. Or other relevant experiences.
* Are passionate about delivering excellent customer value by having an interest in the details as well as on the context- solving customer challenges by applying customer business logic into our deliveries.
* Have a proven record of accomplishment delivering with quality and yet with flexibility as circumstances change.
* Fluent language skills in Swedish and English, verbally and writing. You do also need to have a Swedish citizenship.


 As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from, and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new innovative technologies is something you strive to do.
   

  

**We offer**
 We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing, fast-developing, and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Marjo Huikuri, marjo.huikuri@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Sweden

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries.  At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. title: Laboratory Development Engineer - Automation & Simulation
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**This is us, your new colleagues**
-----------------------------------


Testing, Verification and Materials Technology (VT&MT) is responsible for the operation, maintenance, and development of heavy-duty drivelines testing (engine, transmission, electromobility and Fuel Cells/Hydrogen) and materials technology laboratories. We work both local and global to deliver high-quality results and expert functions within our areas of responsibility. We cooperate close with product owners, technology owners, certification, and compliance as well as other functions. We have test facilities and laboratories where a mix of theory and practical work is necessary to deliver and develop within present and new technologies. VT&MT is a part of Powertrain Engineering, Volvo Group Trucks Technology (GTT) located in Gothenburg.

  

You will be part of the method and technical development team with different expertise areas (software, emissions, measurements, electronics, fluids, mechanical etc.). All work together with one target: To develop world-class test facilities and methods.

**About the role**
------------------


As a Laboratory Development Engineer, you will lead and deliver various development activities, where creativity, quality and flexibility are of prime importance and keys to success. You will be the technical advisor in our development projects for automation and simulation requirements. You will work in tight cooperation with Volvo test and verification engineers, maintenance and operation engineers, project managers, suppliers, and subcontractors.

  

You will act as a mentor on the technical equipment and methods used in the lab and support teams with advice and educational courses. You will also balance your time between office work and work in the lab.

 **Scope of your mission**  

To develop your specialist knowledge, drive, and lead development to create sustainable solutions, strategies & methods within test cell automation and simulation activities. For example:

  

* Develop expert knowledge of our automation systems used in the test cells.
* Work with simulation models and integrate them with test objects in the test cell, either to simulate the remainder of the truck or serve as a digital twin for the test object.
* Develop new test sequences in the automation systems (involves programming to a certain level).
* Define automation systems requirements on new test cell investments.
* Improve working methodology related to automation systems in test cells.
* Support in test cells on automation systems topics.
**Who are you?**
----------------


We believe that you are a flexible person with a positive mindset and can-do attitude. You love to inspire, develop, and motivate your colleagues and yourself, building relationships on a local and global level. With your team spirit, you want to be an important team player, putting the team in first place, ready to do what is needed to make the team more efficient. Strong action will make you take own initiatives when something needs to be done or improved and do that with enthusiasm and high energy.

 *Requirements:*

* University degree in Computer Science, Automation and Mechatronics or equivalent education/experience.
* Experience from being responsible for defining state-of-the-art technology and identifying future trends, as well as driving innovation of new solutions and concepts.
* Skills and experience in programming, e.g., Python, C# or similar.
* Experience in using simulation tools, like MATLAB and Simulink (basic level).
* Holistic view and analytical ability to understand future testing demands, coordinate & synchronize testing demands into plans (test facility road map).
* English proficiency (verbal and written) – Swedish is a merit!

  

We highly value the experience within the area of automotive testing activities, in product development, test engineering or lab development.

**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------

*Due to summer vacations, all applications will be reviewed from week 33 forward. Please do not expect any communication earlier than this. We look forward to receiving your application!*

 **For additional information, please contact** Robert Aslan, Manager Method & Technical Development, at +46 739025312.

 **Last application date:** August 11th, 2024.

**Positions: 2**

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Staff Engineer
description:
**We are Hedin IT**  

...and we shape the digital future for Hedin Mobility Group - one of Europe’s leading mobility enablers with 15,000 employees across 14 countries. Our mission is to revolutionize mobility through cutting-edge digital experiences for our customers and colleagues alike.


We are now looking for a staff Engineer, in which you will hold one of the most pivotal technical roles within our entire organization. You will lead our digital transformation efforts, driving innovative solutions that create a profound impact on our business and set new standards for the industry.

**Join us in our journey to redefine mobility and be a transformative force in an ever-evolving digital landscape.**

 **Being Staff Engineer at Hedin IT means being responsible for:**

* **Technical Design & Team Upleveling:** As the tech lead of tech leads (catchy huh?), you will set the standards and direction for our technical team, ensuring we consistently elevate our performance and capabilities.
* **Strategic Oversight:** Beyond coding (about 20% of your time), you will focus on broader technical strategies, influencing multiple teams to achieve collective greatness.
* **Mentorship & Influence:** Your role involves more than just creating excellent code. You will articulate the 'why' behind technical decisions, inspiring and guiding others to contribute effectively to our development process.
* **Involved in High-Impact Projects:** You will tackle the most challenging and important projects which often span across multiple teams and technical solutions. driving solutions that have a significant influence on our business.
* **Digital Transformation Leadership:** You will play a key role in our company-wide initiative to enhance our digital services, enabling growth and scalability through innovative digital solutions.

**Want a taste of our tech stack?**

* C#/.NET
* React/Next.js, Blazor
* Azure
* GitHub
* Kubernetes
* Terraform
* Datadog

**Who are we looking for?**  

A seasoned engineer with experience in a fast-paced, innovative, and at times, complex environment. We believe you have:

* Experience in software development with deep knowledge of at least some of the technologies within our tech stack
* Strong mentoring skills
* A proven track record of leading and executing high-stakes development projects.
* A strategic mindset with a deep understanding of digital transformation and the ability to implement scalable, automated solutions


If you have experience within the automotive industry, that is seen as a great advantage.


**So, are you ready to accelerate in your career?**  

The Hedin IT recruitment team is on vacation. We are excited to resume the recruitment process when we are back in week 34. In the meantime, do not hesitate to apply already! Responsible for the recruitment is Gabriella Hagström, gabriella.hagstrom@hedinit.com. Have a great summer!

 ***About us:***  

*Since 2017, we have been driving the digital transformation for Hedin Mobility Group, empowering 15,000 employees across 14 countries to shape the future of mobility in Europe. Our mission is to offer the best possible digital experience for both our customers and colleagues within the group. This means you'll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, dedicated colleagues, and great challenges to keep pushing your professional and personal development.*

***What do we offer?***  

*The dynamic and fast paced environment of a scale-up with the stability and resources that comes with being part of a large, established group. The best of both worlds if you ask us.*

*Our modern office located here in Mölndal offers both café and restaurant as well as gym and padel facility (fun fact: we ended up in the top ten best-looking offices in Sweden 2023, if you will allow us to brag a little). Since your well-being is important to us, there is also personal trainers, instructor-led training classes every day and the opportunity to challenge your colleagues in a game of padel. And, of course:*

* *Collective Agreement and ITP pensions.*
* *Flexible working hours*
* *Wellness allowance*
* *30 days of paid vacation*
* *Several car-related benefits*
